definition: AWS console is a web based service that is used by the AWS users to manage and use the services provided by AWS
regions: At the top right corner, AWS console gives 'Region Selectro', It's a drop down that allows the users to change the regions and use the services in that region
As we saw in the previouse lecture, not all the services are available in all the regions. Therefore, switching among the regions gives the users access bunch of other services.
Some services are global, meaning it doesn't matter which region you are in. Those services will stay the same an example Route 53.
Some services are region scoped such as EC2
